body:
<!-- This issue tracker is only for technical issues related to Bitcoin Core.

General bitcoin questions and/or support requests are best directed to the Bitcoin StackExchange at https://bitcoin.stackexchange.com.

For reporting security issues, please read instructions at https://bitcoincore.org/en/contact/.

If the node is "stuck" during sync or giving "block checksum mismatch" errors, please ensure your hardware is stable by running memtest and observe CPU temperature with a load-test tool such as linpack before creating an issue! -->

<!-- Describe the issue -->The funds I sent ended up being 10% of the original fund. Transactions id show the sent BTC with an extra O, making it 90% lower

**Expected [behavior*](url
[](url)
)

<!--- What behavior did you expect? -->Get The Total fund, not 10%


**Actual behavior**

<!--- What was the actual behavior (provide screenshots if the issue is GUI-related)? -->

**To reproduce**

<!--- How reliably can you reproduce the issue, what are the steps to do so? -->I can possibly produce screenshots of tis strange process, I'm a noob so what's obvious to You is "Sanskrit" to Me , but I'll do my best

**System information**

<!-- What version of Bitcoin Core are you using, where did you get it (website, self-compiled, etc)? -->Blockchain. info

<!-- What type of machine are you observing the error on (OS/CPU and disk type)? -->W 10 Pro IntelÂ® Coreâ¢ i3-5010U CPU @ 2.10GHz  SAMSUNG MZ7LN128HCHP-000L1

<!-- GUI-related issue? What is your operating system and its version? If Linux, what is your desktop environment and graphical shell? -->
Edition
Microsoft Windows 10 Pro (64 bitar)
Version (Build)
2009 (10.0.19042)

<!-- Any extra information that might be useful in the debugging process. [-->]([url]([url]([url](url))))
<!--- This is normally the contents of a `debug.log` or `config.log` file. Raw text or a link to a pastebin type site are preferred. -->
title: Funds disappering
